There are numerous resources available that you can share with your employer to make a case for mindfulness and meditation programs in the workplace. Here are a few suggestions:

1. Mindful.org: This website offers a wealth of information on mindfulness, including articles on the benefits of mindfulness in the workplace and tips for starting a workplace mindfulness program.

2. Harvard Business Review: The Harvard Business Review has published several articles on the benefits of mindfulness in the workplace, including "Mindfulness Can Literally Change Your Brain" and "How Meditation Benefits CEOs."

3. Forbes: Forbes has also published articles highlighting the benefits of mindfulness in the workplace, such as "9 Ways Mindfulness Can Make You Happier and More Productive at Work."

4. The American Psychological Association: The American Psychological Association has published research on the benefits of mindfulness and meditation and how they can be used to promote mental health in the workplace.

By sharing these resources and communicating the benefits of mindfulness and meditation, you may convince your employer to implement a program that could be beneficial for you and your colleagues.
